You all know the rewards of dying in the name of Allah. 
 72 virgins. I can't help but wonder why that is considered a reward.
 What does a former warrior who just died in the courageous event of killing a hundred unarmed, unprepared civilians do with 72 virgins? 
 Are they intended for his sexual pleasure? Are they to feed him grapes and bathe him at his leisure? What if 10 of them are not attracted to him? 
 What happens when he has deflowered them all and there are no more virgins? What qualifies a virgin as a reward versus a magnificient voluptuos experienced woman who knows how to make a man happy and appreciates the effort a man puts into tending to her needs as well? 
 I personally suspect that the desire to possess virgins versus experience and "love" comes from a lack of confidence in one's manhood. Which the public expression of that as a desire would be embarrassing as it would be a confession of inadequacy. 
 What say you?

Yossarian

Whether it's true that Islam in general purports this idea I don't know, but it makes perfect sense in some ways.
 Think about it, what do virgins represent, as relates to a warrior? Conquest, reward, wealth (the sheer number of them, think of the cost to maintain that harem...!)
 Giving someone a virgin says to them, "only you are worthy of this. Only you can possess this thing, no other."
 It could also be a reward in the sense that if these fellows are (supposed to be) living pious lives of service to Allah, abstaining from fleshly desire, at the end (after martyrdom) they're of course going to be given "pure" women, as opposed to 72 Jezebel's. No matter that one might desire Jezzie over the others, Allah (as represented) wouldn't have anything to do with someone like her.
